body: I know - that failure was expected - but look at the first array? Far from equal - is there something I am doing wrong?
I've added another test to demonstrate the issue.

The problem is that both '9E6666666' and '9E7777777' are numerical which triggers PHPUnit's numeric comparator. Since both values are infinite in PHP, PHPUnit considers them the same. This certainly isn't desirable. The numeric comparator probably shouldn't accept strings.
On second thought, accepting strings is necessary for something like `$this->assertEquals(3,'3');`. What we should avoid is using the numeric comparator when both values are strings.
@sebastianbergmann: does not invoking the numeric comparator when both values are strings make sense to you?

Where is the code which switches that logic i.e determines a numerical
comparator?

On Friday, October 11, 2013, Jeff Welch wrote:

> @sebastianbergmann https://github.com/sebastianbergmann: does not
> invoking the numeric comparator when both values are strings make sense to
> you?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/1023#issuecomment-26120515
> .

> Where is the code which switches that logic i.e determines a numerical
> comparator?

Relevant code is [here](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/0b50d0a762494d72a83c956a7c90dbf72a432d33/PHPUnit/Framework/Comparator/Numeric.php#L67-L71) and [here](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/0b50d0a762494d72a83c956a7c90dbf72a432d33/PHPUnit/Framework/Comparator/Numeric.php#L90-L92).

So why do the 1X666.. 1X777.. pairs not match but 9e pairs match?

Never mind just read the docs for is_numeric - quite a dilemma as it does support hex. Wonder how many others have had this issue but haven't realised.

@whatthejeff I think for a numerical comparison both values should not be a string (unless they are a float - in which case you want to match using the delta specified).
Thanks for the bug report, @alexw23. The fix for this will land in 3.8.
Thanks for that @whatthejeff might fork it and put into my 3.7 for now :+1:
That sounds like a good idea. Unfortunately we can't put this in 3.7 since it breaks backwards compatibility.
